text.front:
ParsCit: An open-source CRF reference string parsing package
Isaac G. Councill * , C. Lee Giles * , Min-Yen Kan †
* College of Information Sciences & Technology
The Pennsylvania State University
{icouncil,giles}@ist.psu.edu
† Department of Computer Science
National University of Singapore
kanmy@comp.nus.edu.sg
Abstract
We describe ParsCit, a freely available, open-source implementation of a reference string parsing package. At the core of ParsCit is a
trained conditional random field (CRF) model used to label the token sequences in the reference string. A heuristic model wraps this
core with added functionality to identify reference strings from a plain text file, and to retrieve the citation contexts. The package comes
with utilities to run it as a web service or as a standalone utility. We compare ParsCit on three distinct reference string datasets and show
that it compares well with other previously published work.
